Article.Abstract: The lipopolysaccharide (LPS) is up to now the only identified major virulence determinant of Brucella. This bacterium is responsible for brucellosis in animals and for Malta fever in humans. Several monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) directed against various LPS epitopes have been characterized. Two mAbs, named A15-6B3 and B66-2C8, directed against distinct LPS epitopes have been used to select peptides from 11 phage display libraries. The sequences of the selected peptides contain an overrepresentation of either proline or tryptophan residues when selected with either A15-6B3 or B66-2C8 mAbs, respectively. For the best binding peptides, competition with LPS for the binding to the mAb is detected, which suggests that the peptides bind to the paratope of the mAb. The phages selected from the libraries were used to immunise mice, and a weak antibody response directed against LPS has been observed. These data suggest that a subset of the selected peptides are mimotopes of the LPS epitopes.
Article.ArticleTitle: Antigenic properties of peptidic mimics for epitopes of the lipopolysaccharide from Brucella.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antigens, Bacterial(immunology); Brucella(immunology); Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay; Epitopes; Lipopolysaccharides(immunology); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Molecular Mimicry; Molecular Sequence Data; Peptide Library; Peptides(immunology); Proline(immunology); Selection, Genetic; Tryptophan(immunology); Vaccination

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS M epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella sp. No information available on the origin of the mAb. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Fig 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: M type LPS marginally competes with the binding of mAb A15-6B3 to the phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display. The reciprocal assay gives no inhibition (Fig 2A).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS M epitope. Immunization with the phage particle displaying this peptide is reported to induce weak anti-LPS responses in mice. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope competes with the binding of mAb A15-6B3 to M type LPS although the phage particle expressing the peptide (Fig 2 A) gave negative results.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS M epitope. Immunization with the phage particle displaying this peptide is reported to induce weak anti-LPS responses in mice. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope competes with the binding of mAb A15-6B3 to M type LPS, although this effect was not seen with the phage particle expressing the peptide (Fig 2 A).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS M epitope. Immunization with the phage particle displaying this peptide is reported to induce weak anti-LPS responses in mice. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope competes with the binding of Ab A15-6B3 to type M LPS. This effect was also seen with the phage particle expressing the epitopic peptide in both an identical and in the reciprocal assay (fig 2).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The phage particle expressing this epitope at multivalent display marginally competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to A type LPS .

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display marginally competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to A type LPS .

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A type LPS marginally competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to the phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A type LPS competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to the phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A type LPS marginally competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to the phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Immunization with the phage particle displaying this peptide is reported to induce weak anti-LPS responses in mice. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to A type LPS. The same assay with the phage particle expressing the peptide gave unclear results (Fig 2 B). The reciprocal assay with LPS competing with the binding of mAb to phage particle showed no inhibition (Fig 2D).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: mAb B66-2C8 is shown to be specific for this epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Possible mimotope of Brucella sp. LPS A epitope. Peptide selected from phage display library by biopanning against a mAb specific for M epitope of LPS from Brucella. Other mAbs against LPS do not recognize this peptide (Figure 1).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A type LPS marginally competes with the binding of mAb B66-2C8 to the phage particle expressing this epitope in multivalent display.
